CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 12, 1956, pg. 16, reads: "Raymond Hood ...released rookie cop."  Portion of accompanying article by John L. Clark reads: "Two Rookie Cops Pierce Dope Ring - Two veterans of World War II joined the Pittsburgh police force in March, were assigned to the Federal Narcotics Division in early April before they could finish their training at the Police Academy, and by May 4, had won enthusiastic commendation from their superiors in rounding up dope peddlers and users.  These two military veterans and rookie policemen are Raymond Hood (age 31, 157 pounds), two years experience with a unit of the Anti agent for Western Pennsylvania to select young, untrained and unknown police officers to spark the dope round-up, especially in cases where regular Federal agents and city police had been 'spotted' by the junkies..."
TitMainTitle: Police officer Raymond Hood speaking with Pittsburgh Courier newspaper reporter Frank Bolden
